qas.question: In what century was Bhrikuti said to live?
What religion did Araniko help to evangelize?
How many Newar Buddhist monasteries are present in Kathmandu?
Approximately how many monasteries in the Kathmandu area are run by Tibetan Buddhists?

context: Legendary Princess Bhrikuti (<a0_0>7th<a0_0/>-century) and artist Araniko (1245 - <a1_0>1306<a1_0/> AD) from that tradition of Kathmandu valley played a significant role in spreading <a2_0>Buddhism<a2_0/> in Tibet and China. There are over <a3_0>108<a3_0/> traditional monasteries (Bahals and Bahis) in Kathmandu based on Newar Buddhism. Since the 1960s, the permanent Tibetan Buddhist population of Kathmandu has risen significantly so that there are now over <a4_0>fifty<a4_0/> Tibetan Buddhist monasteries in the area. Also, with the modernization of Newar Buddhism, various Theravada Bihars have been established.
